hhsProviders.name: Sunshine House of Fordyce, INC.
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Contact for information on availability.
hhsProviders.description: Provides family-style emergency care for youth in a residential setting, helping families in crisis find temporary relief and support in a nurturing environment.

hhsProviders.name: Youth Home, Inc.
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Services primarily for youth requiring psychiatric care.
hhsProviders.description: A psychiatric residential facility offering mental health treatment, rehabilitation, and long-term support for youth with significant behavioral health challenges.

hhsProviders.name: Consulate of the Republic of Ghana, Arkansas - Delta Region USA
hhsProviders.organization: Consulate of the Republic of Ghana, Arkansas / Delta Region USA
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Available for residents within the consulate territory: Arkansas, Louisiana, Tennessee, Alabama, Missouri, Illinois, Kentucky, Mississippi.
hhsProviders.description: The Consulate provides support to the Ghanaian community in the Arkansas / Delta region and handles consulate duties such as visa issuance, marital and legal assistance, economic development, and travel & tourism support. Visa information includes fees and eligibility, as well as COVID-19 travel restrictions and inoculation requirements. Travelers must have appropriate visas and a valid yellow card with required vaccinations.

hhsProviders.name: Wilson and Field Homes
hhsProviders.organization: The United Methodist Children's Home, Inc.
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: NA
hhsProviders.description: Wilson and Field Homes offers residential and emergency care for children in need, providing a safe and supportive environment under the guidance of The United Methodist Children's Home, Inc.

hhsProviders.name: Western Arkansas Youth Shelter
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: NA
hhsProviders.description: A shelter offering emergency residential care services for youth in Western Arkansas, supported by Comprehensive Juvenile Services, Inc. to provide immediate safe housing and care for young individuals.

hhsProviders.name: Watersprings Ranch
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: NA
hhsProviders.description: Watersprings Ranch provides family-style residential care, including independent and emergency living arrangements, to foster a stable environment for youth in need.

hhsProviders.name: El Consulado de Mexico en Little Rock
services: Civil Registry (Birth Certificates, Dual Nationality, Marriage Certificates, Wills)
Visas for Foreign Nationals (Tourist, Permanent, Diplomatic, Student)
hhsProviders.organization: Consulate of Mexico in Little Rock
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Serves Mexican nationals in Arkansas, Oklahoma, and Tennessee.
hhsProviders.description: The Consulate of Mexico in Little Rock provides support and protection for Mexican citizens, defending their rights and offering assistance in cases of abuse or mistreatment. Services include travel documentation, consular ID issuance, notarial services, and visas. The consulate also promotes Mexican art, culture, and community development in the U.S.

hhsProviders.name: Honorary Consulate of the Czech Republic
hhsProviders.organization: Honorary Consulate of the Czech Republic
hhsProviders.contactPerson: Ms. Lenka Horakova, Honorary Consul General
hhsProviders.description: The Honorary Consulate of the Czech Republic in Little Rock provides consular services like visa processing, document notarization, and assistance for Czech citizens. It promotes trade, tourism, cultural exchanges, and supports the Czech community abroad.

hhsProviders.name: Vera Lloyd Presbyterian Home and Family Services, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Vera Lloyd Presbyterian Home provides residential care, emergency shelter, and transitional living programs for children and families in need. The organization focuses on creating a nurturing environment to foster growth and stability.

hhsProviders.name: United Methodist Children's Home Little Rock Campus
hhsProviders.organization: The United Methodist Children's Home, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: The United Methodist Children's Home in Little Rock provides psychiatric residential treatment for children in a supportive and therapeutic setting. This facility is part of a larger network of care for children with behavioral health needs.

hhsProviders.name: Timothy Hill Children's Ranch
hhsProviders.description: Timothy Hill Children's Ranch offers transitional living programs aimed at helping youth develop independence and life skills in a supportive environment.

hhsProviders.name: The Centers for Youth and Families Monticello
hhsProviders.organization: Centers for Youth and Families, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: The Centers for Youth and Families in Monticello provides residential and psychiatric care to youth, promoting healing and growth through specialized therapeutic programs.

hhsProviders.name: The Boy's Shelter
hhsProviders.description: The Boy's Shelter provides a safe and structured residential environment for boys, focusing on providing stability, support, and care to foster positive development.

hhsProviders.name: Texarkana Baptist Children's Home
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Orphaned, abandoned, or abused children in need of a safe and supportive environment.
hhsProviders.description: Texarkana Baptist Children’s Home offers 24-hour residential care and a faith-based environment for orphaned, abandoned, and abused children. The home emphasizes stability, educational support, and spiritual growth to help children reach their potential.

hhsProviders.name: Teen Challenge Ranch of Northwest Arkansas
hhsProviders.organization: Teen Challenge Ranch of Northwest Arkansas
hhsProviders.description: Teen Challenge Ranch provides faith-based residential programs, including transitional living and family-style care, focused on helping youth overcome challenges through a supportive community.

hhsProviders.name: Southern Christian Home
hhsProviders.description: Southern Christian Home offers a variety of residential services, from family-style care to independent living, aiming to provide safe housing and supportive care for children and youth.

hhsProviders.name: Soaring Wings Ranch
hhsProviders.description: Soaring Wings Ranch provides emergency and family-style residential care for children in a loving, stable, and supportive environment to aid in their growth and development.

hhsProviders.name: Ridge View Program
hhsProviders.description: Ridge View Program, part of Piney Ridge Treatment Center, specializes in sexual rehabilitative services, providing targeted therapeutic programs in a secure residential setting.

hhsProviders.name: Piney Ridge Treatment Center
hhsProviders.description: Piney Ridge Treatment Center offers specialized residential care, including sexual rehabilitative and psychiatric treatment services, in a structured, therapeutic environment for youth in need.

hhsProviders.name: A.B.B.A. House
services: Shelter for Homeless and/or Pregnant Women
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Non-pregnant women can stay up to 3 weeks, pregnant women can stay up to 1 month after childbirth. No drug problems or mental illness.
hhsProviders.description: A.B.B.A. House provides shelter for homeless and/or pregnant women, with specific stay limits based on pregnancy status. The shelter prioritizes a safe environment free from drug problems and mental illness.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Homeless Coalition
hhsProviders.description: The Arkansas Homeless Coalition is a volunteer group advocating for the homeless community. Meetings are held monthly to discuss resources, support, and networking opportunities for homeless advocacy.

hhsProviders.name: BCD, Hoover Treatment Center
hhsProviders.description: The Hoover Treatment Center provides specialized programming for individuals with addiction, offering tailored services to address the complexities of substance abuse.

hhsProviders.name: Centers for Youth and Families, Youth Emergency Shelter
services: Shelter for Homeless and Runaway Youth
hhsProviders.organization: Centers for Youth and Families, Inc.
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Shelter for youth ages 8 to 18; wheelchair accessible; children may stay up to 45 days. Must be DHS clients.
hhsProviders.description: This emergency shelter offers temporary housing for homeless and runaway youth, ages 8 to 18, with a stay limit of up to 45 days. The shelter is accessible and requires DHS client status.

hhsProviders.name: Dorcas House - A Division of Union Rescue Mission
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Domestic Violence Program: Women and children (male children allowed up to 17 years old). Recovery Program: Women with addiction issues (children not permitted).
hhsProviders.description: Dorcas House offers a 9-month domestic violence program for women and children, as well as a recovery program for women with substance or alcohol addiction. The facility has 50 beds for women and children and is wheelchair accessible.

hhsProviders.name: Elim House
services: Long-Term Residential Discipleship Program for Women
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Women in crisis seeking long-term residential discipleship and recovery.
hhsProviders.hours: Contact for program details and availability
hhsProviders.description: Elim House offers a faith-based, long-term residential discipleship program for women in crisis. This Christ-centered program focuses on recovery and personal growth within a supportive community.

hhsProviders.name: Empowerment Village, BCD Inc.
services: Supportive Housing for Special Needs (Low Income, Homeless, Disabled)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Available to Arkansans with low income, those experiencing homelessness, or individuals with disabilities that affect their income or require supportive services.
hhsProviders.description: Empowerment Village, operated by BCD Inc., offers supportive housing to individuals with special needs, including low-income residents, homeless individuals, and those with disabilities that impact their capacity for self-sufficiency.

hhsProviders.name: Family Promise of Pulaski County
services: Shelter, Food, Transportation, and Case Management for Homeless Families with Children
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Homeless families with children under 18.
hhsProviders.description: Family Promise of Pulaski County partners with churches of various faiths to provide shelter, food, transportation, and case management for homeless families with children, supporting their journey towards stability.

hhsProviders.name: Freewill Baptist Family Ministries, Florence Crittenton Home
services: Emergency Shelter for DHS Involved Children
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Serves DHS-involved children ages 12 to 17, both males and females, including sibling groups. Must have IQ above 70 and be able to attend school.
hhsProviders.description: Florence Crittenton Home provides a 24-hour emergency shelter for DHS-involved children, ages 12 to 17, in a structured and supportive environment. The shelter accommodates both male and female youth, including sibling groups.

hhsProviders.name: Gaines House
services: Transitional Living for Homeless Women with Disabilities
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Women 18 or older who have been treated for mental, physical, or emotional disabilities.
hhsProviders.description: Gaines House provides transitional housing for homeless women with disabilities in a supportive, supervised setting. It focuses on preparing women 18 and older with mental, physical, or emotional disabilities for independent living.

hhsProviders.name: Gyst House
services: Transitional Housing for Individuals with Substance Abuse Issues
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals with substance abuse issues seeking structured recovery support.
hhsProviders.description: Gyst House offers transitional housing for men and women recovering from substance abuse, providing a structured, supportive environment that fosters personal growth and stability.

hhsProviders.name: Perimeter of the Ozarks
hhsProviders.description: Perimeter of the Ozarks offers psychiatric residential treatment services for individuals needing mental health support, operated by Woodridge Northwest, LLC.

hhsProviders.name: Perimeter Behavioral of West Memphis
hhsProviders.description: Perimeter Behavioral of West Memphis provides psychiatric residential treatment for individuals with mental health needs, supporting them in a structured care environment.

hhsProviders.name: Perimeter Behavioral of Forrest City
hhsProviders.organization: Woodridge Behavioral Care of Forrest City, LLC
hhsProviders.description: Perimeter Behavioral of Forrest City offers sexual rehabilitative and psychiatric residential services, providing specialized care for individuals in need of rehabilitative and mental health support.

hhsProviders.name: Paragould Children's Home
services: Life Skills and Household Responsibility Training
hhsProviders.description: Paragould Children's Home provides family-style and emergency residential care for children, creating a safe and nurturing environment for those in need.

hhsProviders.name: Ouachita Children Youth and Family Services
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Children in need of a safe, structured, and faith-based residential care environment.
hhsProviders.description: Children’s Home in Paragould offers a family-style residential environment with dedicated houseparents in nine cottages. The program includes faith-based guidance, equine therapy, and a variety of agricultural and 4-H programs to foster personal growth and responsibility.

hhsProviders.name: Ophelia Polk Moore Home
hhsProviders.organization: The United Methodist Children's Home, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Ophelia Polk Moore Home offers residential child care services, providing a safe and caring environment for children in need.

hhsProviders.name: Hand Up Housing of Arkansas
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Contact for eligibility requirements
hhsProviders.description: Hand Up Housing of Arkansas provides a Christ-centered, case-managed program to help individuals transition from homelessness to self-sufficiency.

hhsProviders.name: HOUSEABOUTIT, Community Economic Development Agency, Benefit Enrollment Center (BEC) of Pulaski County
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Low-income residents with housing issues.
hhsProviders.description: HOUSEABOUTIT assists low-income residents with various housing issues and offers benefit enrollment support. Programs are aimed at developing solutions for sustainable housing.

hhsProviders.name: Immerse Arkansas
services: Housing and Program Support for Youth
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Youth ages 14 - 21 in need of housing and life skills support
hhsProviders.description: Immerse Arkansas provides housing and program support for vulnerable youth ages 14-21, focusing on helping them transition to independence. The organization offers a safe, stable environment and critical resources for personal and professional development.

hhsProviders.name: Little Rock Compassion Center (Men’s)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Must be over 18, sober, and possess ID
hhsProviders.description: The Little Rock Compassion Center provides a men’s homeless shelter, offering a safe place for adult men over 18 who are sober and possess identification. The center focuses on support services and guidance, though medical services are not available.

hhsProviders.name: Little Rock Compassion Center (Women’s)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Must be over 18, sober, and possess ID
hhsProviders.description: The Little Rock Compassion Center provides a homeless shelter for women over 18, focusing on safe shelter with a requirement for sobriety and identification. Support services are offered for women seeking stability, though medical services are not available on-site.

hhsProviders.name: Little Rock, AR Low Income Housing List
services: List of Low Income Apartment Complexes
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Low-income HUD eligible households
hhsProviders.description: An online listing of 38 low-income apartment complexes in or near Little Rock, AR, providing critical housing options and information for HUD-eligible households, addressing the shortage of affordable housing.

hhsProviders.name: Open Arms Shelter
hhsProviders.description: Open Arms Shelter provides residential and emergency child care services in a safe, supportive environment for youth in need of immediate shelter.

hhsProviders.name: Northwest Arkansas Children's Shelter
hhsProviders.description: The Northwest Arkansas Children's Shelter offers both residential and emergency care for children in crisis, providing a safe and nurturing environment.

hhsProviders.name: Neurorestorative Timber Ridge
hhsProviders.description: Neurorestorative Timber Ridge provides both residential child care and psychiatric treatment services, focusing on comprehensive mental health support.

hhsProviders.name: Millcreek of Arkansas PRTF
hhsProviders.description: Millcreek of Arkansas PRTF offers specialized psychiatric residential treatment for children in a structured environment focused on mental health.

hhsProviders.name: Millcreek of Arkansas
hhsProviders.description: Millcreek of Arkansas provides residential child care services, offering a secure and nurturing environment for children requiring specialized support.

hhsProviders.name: Maggie House
hhsProviders.organization: Free Will Baptist Family Ministries, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Maggie House offers residential care for children in need, providing a supportive and structured environment to help them thrive.

hhsProviders.name: Metropolitan Housing Alliance (MHA)
services: Federal Subsidized Housing and Housing Assistance
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Low-income individuals and families residing in Little Rock, Arkansas.
hhsProviders.description: MHA provides federally subsidized housing and rental assistance programs to low-income individuals and families within Little Rock, supporting their housing needs and promoting stability within the community.

hhsProviders.name: Nehemiah House, A Division of Union Rescue Mission
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Men in need of a faith-based recovery program.
hhsProviders.description: Nehemiah House offers a structured 9-month faith-based recovery program for men, focusing on spiritual and personal growth. The facility has a capacity of 46 beds, is wheelchair accessible, and provides a supportive environment for rehabilitation.

hhsProviders.name: Our House
services: Working Shelter for Men, Women, and Families
Mental Health and Substance Abuse Programs
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Must work a minimum of 32 hours per week within 21 days of moving in.
hhsProviders.hours: Office hours: Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00pm; Shelter is 24/7
hhsProviders.description: Our House provides a structured, long-term working shelter environment for men, women, and families, offering extensive educational programs, support for domestic violence recovery, mental health, and substance abuse services to promote stability and independence.

hhsProviders.name: Phoenix Recovery Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Women in need of transitional housing support.
hhsProviders.description: Phoenix Recovery Center provides transitional housing for women in a structured, supportive environment designed to facilitate recovery and encourage self-sufficiency. With professional support and resources, the center helps women transition to independent living.

hhsProviders.name: Pulaski County Emergency Rental Assistance (ERA)
services: Rental and Utility Assistance due to COVID-19
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Residents unable to pay rent or utilities due to COVID-19.
hhsProviders.description: Pulaski County Emergency Rental Assistance Program offers rental and utility assistance for residents impacted by COVID-19. A government-funded initiative aimed at preventing homelessness during the pandemic.

hhsProviders.name: Pulaski County Housing Programs
services: Permanent Supportive Housing for Disabled Persons
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Disabled individuals in need of permanent supportive housing.
hhsProviders.description: Pulaski County Housing Programs, part of the Continuum of Care, provides permanent supportive housing for disabled individuals, supported by federal funds and additional partnering sources.

hhsProviders.name: Pulaski County Emergency Solution Grant (ESG) Program
services: Assistance for At-Risk and Homeless Families
hhsProviders.organization: Pulaski County Government and Arkansas Department of Human Services
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Families at imminent risk of homelessness or literally homeless.
hhsProviders.description: The ESG Program provides immediate assistance for families at risk of homelessness or currently homeless, focusing on quickly helping participants achieve stable permanent housing after a crisis.

hhsProviders.name: Pulaski County Family Self-Sufficiency Program (FSS)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Participants selected from PCHA Housing Choice Voucher program.
hhsProviders.description: The FSS Program empowers participants from the PCHA Housing Choice Voucher program, providing education, job training, and financial literacy counseling to help families achieve financial independence over a five-year period.

hhsProviders.name: Pulaski County Housing Opportunities for Persons With AIDS (HOPWA)
services: Housing Support for Individuals with HIV/AIDS
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Low-income persons living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) who are homeless or at risk of homelessness.
hhsProviders.description: The HOPWA program supports low-income individuals living with HIV/AIDS, providing housing assistance and related services to achieve housing stability and address health and life challenges.

hhsProviders.name: Pulaski County Tenant-Based Rental Assistance (TBRA)
services: Temporary Rental Assistance for Low-Income Families
hhsProviders.organization: Pulaski County Community Services and Arkansas Development Finance Authority (ADFA)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Low to very low-income families awaiting a permanent housing subsidy.
hhsProviders.description: The TBRA program provides temporary rental assistance to families awaiting a permanent subsidy, addressing affordable housing needs in the community and enhancing the ability to secure decent, affordable housing.

hhsProviders.name: Salvation Army
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Women and families in need of emergency shelter.
hhsProviders.description: The Salvation Army Center of Hope offers emergency shelter for women and families, with a 20-bed facility that includes three private family rooms. Guests are provided with daily breakfast and access to spiritual support services.

hhsProviders.name: Sober Living
services: In-Patient Drug and Alcohol Abuse Transitional Housing
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Court-approved alternative to incarceration for individuals with drug and alcohol abuse issues.
hhsProviders.description: Sober Living provides a court-approved alternative to incarceration, offering fee-based transitional housing for men and women struggling with substance abuse issues. Residents are required to stay for a minimum of six months to support lasting recovery.

hhsProviders.name: St. Francis House
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to veterans requiring residential support services; eligibility screening required.
hhsProviders.description: St. Francis House provides residential placement and support services for veterans, working closely with the Veterans Day Treatment Center to offer a stable environment and resources for former service members in need.

hhsProviders.name: Veteran’s Day Treatment Center
services: Access to VA Programs and Services
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Veterans in need of access to VA programs.
hhsProviders.description: The Veteran's Day Treatment Center provides veterans with access to essential VA programs and services, including housing support through partnerships like the St. Francis House. It serves as a resource hub for veterans seeking assistance in various aspects of post-service life.

hhsProviders.name: Little Creek Behavioral Health
hhsProviders.description: Little Creek Behavioral Health provides psychiatric residential treatment for individuals requiring specialized mental health support in a structured environment.

hhsProviders.name: Joseph Pfeifer Kiwanis Camp
hhsProviders.organization: Kiwanis Activities of Little Rock, Arkansas, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: The Joseph Pfeifer Kiwanis Camp offers residential child care facilities in a supportive and structured environment, focusing on positive youth development.

hhsProviders.name: JoAnna Magale Manor
hhsProviders.organization: The United Methodist Children's Home, Inc.
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Children in need of residential care
hhsProviders.description: JoAnna Magale Manor provides residential care services for children in need, offering a structured and nurturing environment. Services include supervision, emotional support, and activities aimed at promoting healthy development.

hhsProviders.name: Immerse Arkansas
hhsProviders.description: Immerse Arkansas provides transitional living programs for youth, assisting them in developing independence and life skills in a supportive environment.

hhsProviders.name: H.A.V.E.N
hhsProviders.description: H.A.V.E.N provides both residential and emergency child care services in a safe and secure setting, meeting the immediate needs of children in crisis.

hhsProviders.name: Girl's Shelter of Fort Smith
hhsProviders.description: Girl's Shelter of Fort Smith offers family-style residential care for girls, creating a supportive environment to foster growth and stability.

hhsProviders.name: Women and Children First
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Victims of domestic violence seeking shelter and support services
hhsProviders.description: Women and Children First provides a safe, secure shelter and supportive services for victims of domestic violence. Services include a 24-hour hotline, crisis intervention, court advocacy, counseling, support groups, and educational outreach to the community.

hhsProviders.name: Fostering Change Residential Community Reintegration
hhsProviders.description: Fostering Change offers residential child care and transitional living programs, supporting community reintegration for youth in a structured and nurturing environment.

hhsProviders.name: Fort Smith Children’s Emergency Shelter
hhsProviders.description: Fort Smith Children’s Emergency Shelter provides residential and emergency shelter services, along with transitional living, for children in need of immediate support.

hhsProviders.name: Elizabeth Mitchell Centers
hhsProviders.organization: Centers for Youth and Families, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Elizabeth Mitchell Centers offer both residential and psychiatric treatment services for youth in need of structured mental health support.

hhsProviders.name: East Arkansas Youth Services
hhsProviders.description: East Arkansas Youth Services provides residential and emergency child care services, focusing on immediate support for youth in need.

hhsProviders.name: Delta Family Health and Fitness for Children
hhsProviders.organization: Delta Family Health and Fitness for Children, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Delta Family Health and Fitness for Children provides emergency and psychiatric residential care, supporting children with both immediate and long-term mental health needs.

hhsProviders.name: Dana's House
hhsProviders.description: Dana's House provides residential and emergency care for children, offering a stable environment for youth in need of shelter and support.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Cares
services: Transitional Housing for Women with Children
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Women with children or pregnant women with substance abuse or mental health issues.
hhsProviders.description: Arkansas Cares offers substance abuse treatment and transitional housing for women with children or who are pregnant, addressing both substance abuse and mental health needs.

hhsProviders.name: Bridgeway Hospital
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Accepts most insurance; payment required for services.
hhsProviders.description: Bridgeway Hospital provides private inpatient psychiatric care, focusing on mental health treatment and support for individuals in need. The facility accepts most insurance plans.

hhsProviders.name: Centers for Youth and Families (Adults)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Adults over 18
hhsProviders.description: The Centers for Youth and Families outpatient clinic offers mental health support and counseling services for adults over 18, fostering mental wellness and support.

hhsProviders.name: Centers for Youth and Families (Children)
services: Mental Health Support for Children and Adolescents
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Children and adolescents ages 2 through 20.
hhsProviders.description: The Centers for Youth and Families outpatient clinic offers comprehensive mental health services for children and adolescents aged 2 through 20, with crisis support available after hours.

hhsProviders.name: El Zocalo Centro de Recursos para los Inmigrantes
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Spanish-speaking adults
hhsProviders.description: El Zocalo provides a welcoming space for Spanish-speaking adults, offering support groups, workshops, life coaching, and mental health service navigation in a bilingual environment.

hhsProviders.name: Family Service Agency
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to all individuals and families; sliding fee scale based on income.
hhsProviders.description: Family Service Agency offers a range of mental health counseling services on a sliding fee scale, assisting individuals and families with issues like depression, grief, domestic violence, anger management, and marital challenges.

hhsProviders.name: L.O.V.E. “Let Our Violence End” Inc. (Healing Waters Outreach Center)
services: Mental Health Counseling for Violence Prevention
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to individuals seeking counseling for violence prevention and emotional well-being
hhsProviders.description: L.O.V.E. offers licensed mental health counseling services dedicated to violence prevention and emotional healing. The center focuses on fostering resilience and guiding individuals away from conflict through therapeutic intervention. Services are available by appointment, with fees and eligibility discussed upon request.

hhsProviders.name: P.A.T.H Human Trafficking Statewide Crisis Helpline
services: Crisis Support for Human Trafficking Survivors
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Survivors of sexual abuse, all genders and ages
hhsProviders.description: P.A.T.H provides a 24-hour crisis helpline for survivors of human trafficking and sexual abuse, with support available for all genders and ages. Services include day treatment programs and referrals to additional resources.

hhsProviders.name: Professional Counseling Associates
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals in need of mental health support services
hhsProviders.description: Professional Counseling Associates provides a wide range of mental health services, including crisis intervention, comprehensive assessments, therapy, medication management, and residential supports. With multiple locations, they offer accessible care to meet community mental health needs.

hhsProviders.name: U.A.M.S. Crisis Stabilization Unit
hhsProviders.organization: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (U.A.M.S.)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Adults in need of crisis stabilization
hhsProviders.description: The U.A.M.S. Crisis Stabilization Unit offers 24/7 therapeutic psychiatric services as an alternative to inpatient hospitalization or emergency room visits, serving all adults regardless of insurance status or ability to pay. The unit also provides services for individuals with chemical dependency issues, offering critical stabilization and support.

hhsProviders.name: U.A.M.S. Walker Family Clinic
hhsProviders.organization: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Adults aged 18 years and up
hhsProviders.description: The Walker Family Clinic at U.A.M.S. offers outpatient mental health services, including individual counseling and psychiatric care, for adults aged 18 and older. With a multidisciplinary team, the clinic provides comprehensive support, addressing a variety of mental health needs through collaborative care.

hhsProviders.name: Promoting Positive Emotions (P.P.E.)
services: Free Crisis Counseling for COVID-19 Response
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Pulaski County residents impacted by COVID-19
hhsProviders.description: Promoting Positive Emotions (P.P.E.), a FEMA-funded initiative through Stay Positive Arkansas, offers free crisis counseling for Pulaski County residents affected by COVID-19. Support includes quarantine-related mental health counseling, resource connection for job loss, homelessness support, and assistance for first responders. Services are accessible via phone, video, and in-person sessions.

hhsProviders.name: Dacus RTC
hhsProviders.organization: The United Methodist Children's Home, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Dacus RTC provides psychiatric residential treatment for children, focusing on comprehensive mental health support in a structured environment.

hhsProviders.name: Curt, Cliff & Opal Young Children's Home
hhsProviders.organization: Free Will Baptist Family Ministries, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: The Curt, Cliff & Opal Young Children's Home offers residential child care services in a supportive and nurturing environment.

hhsProviders.name: Crestview House
hhsProviders.description: Crestview House provides residential child care in a structured environment, offering support and care for children in need.

hhsProviders.name: Consolidated Youth Services
hhsProviders.description: Consolidated Youth Services offers a range of services, including residential child care, emergency shelter, and a sexual rehabilitative program, providing critical support for youth.

hhsProviders.name: COMPACT Family Services
hhsProviders.organization: Assemblies of God Family Services Agency
hhsProviders.description: COMPACT Family Services provides residential child care, emergency shelter, transitional living, and independent living programs, fostering growth and independence for children and young adults.

hhsProviders.name: Cartwright House
hhsProviders.description: Cartwright House offers residential child care services, providing a stable and caring environment for children and youth.

hhsProviders.name: Capstone Treatment Center
hhsProviders.description: Capstone Treatment Center provides residential child care and therapeutic services, focusing on supporting children in a structured environment.

hhsProviders.name: Benton County Alternative Placement
hhsProviders.description: Benton County Alternative Placement offers emergency residential child care for children in need of immediate shelter and support.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Sheriff's Youth Ranches - Bethesda
hhsProviders.description: Arkansas Sheriff's Youth Ranches - Bethesda provides a range of services including residential child care, family-style care, independent living, and transitional programs to support youth development and independence.

hhsProviders.name: Arbor House
hhsProviders.description: Arbor House provides residential, emergency, and transitional living services for youth in a safe and supportive environment.

hhsProviders.name: Lifetime Adoption, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Lifetime Adoption, Inc. offers adoption services, facilitating connections between children in need of a home and families looking to adopt.

hhsProviders.name: The Answer Foster Care
hhsProviders.description: The Answer Foster Care provides foster care placement services, offering support and resources for foster children and families.

hhsProviders.name: Western Arkansas Therapeutic Children's Homes
hhsProviders.description: Western Arkansas Therapeutic Children's Homes provides therapeutic foster care services, focusing on meeting the specialized needs of foster children.

hhsProviders.name: Watersprings Ranch 1
hhsProviders.description: Watersprings Ranch offers both adoption and foster care services, providing stable and nurturing placements for children in need.

hhsProviders.name: Treatment Homes, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Treatment Homes, Inc. provides therapeutic foster care services, offering specialized support for children with emotional and behavioral needs.

hhsProviders.name: The Gladney Center for Adoption, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: The Gladney Center for Adoption offers both adoption and foster care services, helping children find permanent and loving homes.

hhsProviders.name: Sparrow's Promise
hhsProviders.description: Sparrow's Promise provides adoption and foster care services, supporting children and families through each step of the process.

hhsProviders.name: Southern Christian Children's Home, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Southern Christian Children's Home provides foster care services, offering a safe and nurturing environment for children awaiting permanent placement.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas AA Central Office
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to individuals seeking support in their recovery from alcohol addiction.
hhsProviders.description: Arkansas AA Central Office provides information on Alcoholics Anonymous meetings throughout Arkansas, including meeting dates, times, and locations.

hhsProviders.name: Al-Anon and Alateen
services: Support for Friends and Family of Alcoholics
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Friends and family of alcoholics
hhsProviders.description: Al-Anon and Alateen groups provide fellowship and support for relatives and friends of alcoholics, offering a space to share experiences, strength, and hope to help solve common challenges.

hhsProviders.name: Baptist Medical Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Medicaid, Medicare, or private insurance required; self-pay options available.
hhsProviders.description: Baptist Medical Center offers inpatient detox and dual diagnosis treatment for individuals dealing with alcohol and drug addiction, except methadone. Private insurance, Medicare, or Medicaid is required, with a self-pay option for substance abuse treatment.

hhsProviders.name: BCD Hoover Treatment Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Call for fees
hhsProviders.description: BCD Hoover Treatment Center provides long-term inpatient treatment for substance abuse, including amphetamines, meth, and cocaine. The center offers a work program supporting client recovery but does not provide detox services.

hhsProviders.name: Chance Sobriety
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Clients must be employable or already employed
hhsProviders.description: Chance Sobriety offers long-term substance abuse treatment incorporating a work program. Clients are provided transportation for work assignments, and services focus on rehabilitation through structured programs. Call for detailed fee information.

hhsProviders.name: Cocaine Anonymous (C.A.)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals seeking recovery from drug addiction
hhsProviders.description: Cocaine Anonymous (C.A.) focuses on the personal recovery and continued sobriety of individuals with drug addiction. The fellowship provides support without engaging in research, treatment, or drug education.

hhsProviders.name: Compassion Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Men and women needing long-term substance abuse treatment, able to participate in work exchange or savings program.
hhsProviders.description: Compassion Center provides a long-term treatment facility for men and women. Clients work in exchange for fees if unemployed, or save 75% of income if working or on disability. The center emphasizes structured support and rehabilitation.

hhsProviders.name: Dorcas House: A Division of Union Rescue Mission
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Women must complete an interview before entry
hhsProviders.description: Dorcas House offers a 9-month long-term treatment program for women, providing shelter, counseling, and life skills development. A $75 deposit is required upon entry, refundable upon successful program completion.

hhsProviders.name: Family Service Agency - Central Little Rock Promise
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Available to individuals in need of substance abuse counseling, with fees based on a sliding scale.
hhsProviders.description: Family Service Agency - Central Little Rock Promise offers counseling for substance abuse, using a sliding fee scale to provide affordable mental health support and addiction recovery services.

hhsProviders.name: Gyst House
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Must not need detox, must be able to work
hhsProviders.description: Gyst House is a coed long-term treatment facility that accepts parolees and court-ordered clients. An entry fee of $250 is required, and clients must be able to work.

hhsProviders.name: Hope Rises
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Court-ordered; affiliated with ADC/ACC
hhsProviders.description: Hope Rises is a women’s inpatient treatment facility offering a structured 21-day program. Accepts court-ordered clients, specifically those affiliated with the Arkansas Department of Corrections (ADC) and Arkansas Community Correction (ACC).

hhsProviders.name: L.O.V.E. “Let Our Violence End” Inc. (Healing Waters Outreach Center)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to anyone seeking support for addiction recovery
hhsProviders.description: L.O.V.E. hosts weekly 12-step 'Victory over Addiction' meetings every Thursday evening, creating a welcoming space for those recovering from addiction. This support group offers guidance, accountability, and a community dedicated to overcoming addiction and fostering personal growth.

hhsProviders.name: Narcotics Anonymous (N.A.)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Desire to stop using drugs
hhsProviders.description: Narcotics Anonymous (N.A.) is a fellowship of men and women recovering from drug addiction who meet regularly to support each other in maintaining abstinence. The only requirement for membership is the desire to stop using.

hhsProviders.name: Soaring Wings Ranch (Placement)
hhsProviders.description: Soaring Wings Ranch offers adoption and foster care placement services, providing children in need with a supportive and stable home environment.

hhsProviders.name: Shared Beginnings
hhsProviders.description: Shared Beginnings provides adoption services, offering a compassionate approach to help connect children with adoptive families.

hhsProviders.name: Ozark Guidance Center
hhsProviders.description: Ozark Guidance Center provides foster care and therapeutic foster care services, supporting children with specialized needs in a nurturing environment.

hhsProviders.name: Ouachita Children's Center (Residential Placement)
hhsProviders.description: Ouachita Children's Center offers residential placement services, providing a structured environment for children in need of placement.

hhsProviders.name: Mid-South Health Systems, Inc. (West Memphis)
hhsProviders.organization: Northeast Arkansas Community Mental Health Center, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Mid-South Health Systems in West Memphis provides therapeutic foster care services, offering specialized support for children with therapeutic needs.

hhsProviders.name: Mid-South Health Systems, Inc. (Jonesboro)
hhsProviders.description: Mid-South Health Systems in Jonesboro provides therapeutic foster care services, offering care for children with specific therapeutic needs in a supportive environment.

hhsProviders.name: Lifeline Children's Services, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Lifeline Children's Services provides adoption and foster care services, offering support for children and families in the adoption and foster care process.

hhsProviders.name: Kindred Spirits Adoption Services, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Kindred Spirits Adoption Services specializes in adoption services, supporting families and children through the adoption process.

hhsProviders.name: Free Will Baptist Family Ministries, Inc.
hhsProviders.organization: Free Will Baptist Family Ministries, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Free Will Baptist Family Ministries provides foster care services, focusing on offering a nurturing environment for children in need of foster care.

hhsProviders.name: East Arkansas Youth Services (Residential Placement)
hhsProviders.description: East Arkansas Youth Services provides residential placement services, supporting youth in a structured and safe environment.

hhsProviders.name: Division of Youth Services
hhsProviders.description: The Division of Youth Services offers residential placement for children, providing essential support and guidance in a structured environment.

hhsProviders.name: Division of Children and Family Services
hhsProviders.description: The Division of Children and Family Services provides a range of services including adoption, foster care, residential placement, and therapeutic foster care to support children and families.

hhsProviders.name: Destined to Win/Second Chance Ranch, Inc.
hhsProviders.organization: Destined to Win/Second Chance Ranch, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Destined to Win/Second Chance Ranch provides foster care and therapeutic foster care services, supporting children in a structured, nurturing environment.

hhsProviders.name: Counseling Clinic, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Counseling Clinic, Inc. offers residential placement services, providing a safe and structured environment for children in need.

hhsProviders.name: Counseling Associates, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Counseling Associates, Inc. provides therapeutic foster care services, supporting children with specific therapeutic needs in a foster environment.

hhsProviders.name: Counseling and Education Center, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Counseling and Education Center, Inc. provides therapeutic foster care services for children with therapeutic needs, focusing on a supportive foster environment.

hhsProviders.name: Consolidated Youth Services (Residential Placement)
hhsProviders.description: Consolidated Youth Services provides residential placement services, offering a stable environment for youth in need of support.

hhsProviders.name: Comprehensive Juvenile Services
hhsProviders.description: Comprehensive Juvenile Services offers foster care and residential placement services, providing structured support for youth in need.

hhsProviders.name: Nehemiah House: A Division of Union Rescue Mission
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Must have valid ID, Social Security card, proof of insurance; no sex offenders.
hhsProviders.hours: 24/7 residential program; office hours Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00pm
hhsProviders.description: Nehemiah House offers a 12-month, faith-based long-term treatment program for men, emphasizing recovery through spiritual growth and structured support. An $80 non-refundable application fee is required, with an initial interview to assess program readiness.

hhsProviders.name: Phoenix Recovery Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Women seeking a sober, supportive living environment.
hhsProviders.hours: Open 24/7 for residents; office hours Monday - Friday 9:00am - 5:00pm
hhsProviders.description: Phoenix Recovery Center provides a sober living facility for women in recovery, offering a supportive, drug-free environment. This facility is dedicated to helping women establish a foundation for long-term sobriety with access to resources and peer support.

hhsProviders.name: Quality Living Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals seeking substance abuse recovery support
hhsProviders.description: Quality Living Center provides comprehensive coed substance abuse treatment with dedicated residences for men and women. Services focus on holistic recovery, with counseling and support tailored to each individual. Contact the center for fee information.

hhsProviders.name: Recovery Center of Arkansas, Riverbend
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Detox completed, interview required
hhsProviders.description: The Recovery Center of Arkansas, Riverbend provides long-term substance abuse treatment for both men and women. Entry requires completed detox and an interview. The center offers indigent beds monthly; call at the beginning of the month to inquire about availability.

hhsProviders.name: Compact Family Services (Placement)
hhsProviders.description: Compact Family Services offers adoption, foster care, and therapeutic foster care services, providing a nurturing environment for children in need.

hhsProviders.name: Community Services, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Community Services, Inc. provides residential and therapeutic foster care placements, supporting youth in a safe and structured environment.

hhsProviders.name: Children’s Homes, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Children’s Homes, Inc. offers adoption and foster care services, supporting children and families in need of a stable home environment.

hhsProviders.name: Children Encountering Transitions
hhsProviders.description: Children Encountering Transitions provides therapeutic foster care for children, offering specialized support for children with therapeutic needs.

hhsProviders.name: Centers for Youth and Families (Therapeutic Foster Care)
services: Therapeutic Foster Care - Sexual Rehabilitative Program
hhsProviders.organization: Centers for Youth and Families, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Centers for Youth and Families offers foster care, therapeutic foster care, and sexual rehabilitative programs, supporting children with specialized therapeutic needs.

hhsProviders.name: Bridge of Hope - Hope House
hhsProviders.description: Bridge of Hope - Hope House provides foster care services, offering a safe and supportive environment for children in need of a stable home.

hhsProviders.name: Bethany Christian Services of Arkansas
hhsProviders.description: Bethany Christian Services of Arkansas offers adoption and foster care services, providing a range of supportive services for families and children in need.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Baptist Children's Homes and Family Ministries
hhsProviders.organization: Arkansas Baptist Children's Homes and Family Ministries
hhsProviders.description: Arkansas Baptist Children's Homes and Family Ministries provides adoption and foster care services, supporting children and families through faith-based care.

hhsProviders.name: An Angel's Choice Adoption Agency, Inc.
hhsProviders.organization: An Angel's Choice Adoption Agency, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: An Angel's Choice Adoption Agency provides adoption services, assisting families and children with a compassionate approach to adoption.

hhsProviders.name: American Adoptions of Kansas LLC dba American Adoptions
hhsProviders.description: American Adoptions provides comprehensive adoption services, supporting families and children through the entire adoption process.

hhsProviders.name: Alliance For Children, Inc.
hhsProviders.description: Alliance For Children, Inc. provides adoption services, supporting the adoption process for families seeking to provide a loving home.

hhsProviders.name: ABBA Adoption, LLC
hhsProviders.description: ABBA Adoption provides adoption and foster care services, focusing on creating stable and loving homes for children in need.

hhsProviders.name: Serenity Park Recovery Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals seeking comprehensive substance abuse treatment
hhsProviders.hours: Call for availability and program schedule
hhsProviders.description: Serenity Park Recovery Center provides holistic, evidence-based treatment to empower individuals and their families to live sober and productive lives. The center offers tailored recovery tools, focusing on both physical and mental wellness.

hhsProviders.name: Sober Living
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Affiliated with ACC; court-approved alternative program for men with substance abuse challenges.
hhsProviders.description: Sober Living offers transitional housing with drug and alcohol services tailored for men in recovery. The program supports participants in building a stable foundation for sobriety. Fees may apply, and residents are encouraged to contact the center for more information.

hhsProviders.name: U.A.M.S. Crisis Stabilization Unit
hhsProviders.organization: Pulaski County Regional Crisis Stabilization Unit
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to all regardless of insurance or ability to pay
hhsProviders.description: The U.A.M.S. Crisis Stabilization Unit provides short-term psychiatric support for adults needing alternatives to inpatient psychiatric hospitalization or emergency rooms. This unit offers psychosocial assessments, medication management, individual and group therapy, case management, and detox support. Services are accessible 24/7 and are available to all, regardless of insurance status or ability to pay.

hhsProviders.name: Veteran’s Substance Abuse Treatment Services
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Veterans eligible for VA services
hhsProviders.description: Veteran’s Substance Abuse Treatment Services offers specialized support for veterans facing substance abuse challenges. Services are available on weekdays, and the program is designed to address the unique needs of veterans in a supportive, accessible setting.

hhsProviders.name: National Center for Missing & Exploited Children
services: Support for Missing and Exploited Children
hhsProviders.organization: National Center for Missing & Exploited Children (NCMEC)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to families, law enforcement, and the public for cases involving missing or exploited children.
hhsProviders.description: The National Center for Missing & Exploited Children offers around-the-clock support, resources, and advocacy for cases involving missing and exploited children. Their hotline provides assistance to families, the public, and law enforcement agencies nationwide.

hhsProviders.name: PHUMC Diaper Bank

address.street: 4823 Woodlawn Drive, Pulaski Heights United Methodist Church Gathering Hall

hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Pre-registration via email required
hhsProviders.description: PHUMC Diaper Bank offers drive-thru diaper distribution on the first Wednesday of each month. Pre-registration via email is required.

hhsProviders.name: Pinnacle Pointe Hospital
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Children and adolescents ages 5-17 in need of behavioral healthcare
hhsProviders.description: Pinnacle Pointe Hospital is Arkansas’ largest behavioral inpatient facility specializing in children and adolescents ages 5-17. It offers comprehensive, 24/7 behavioral health services with no-cost assessments to determine the appropriate care for each youth.

hhsProviders.name: Pulaski County Cooperative Extension, 4-H
hhsProviders.organization: University of Arkansas System, Division of Agriculture
hhsProviders.description: Pulaski County Cooperative Extension offers 4-H youth development programs in agriculture and more, providing educational activities for young people.

hhsProviders.name: Pulaski County Youth Services
hhsProviders.description: Pulaski County Youth Services provides quality enrichment and educational programs for youth across Pulaski County, with a focus on mobilizing community resources.

hhsProviders.name: Recycle Bikes for Kids
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Call for appointments and requirements
hhsProviders.description: Recycle Bikes for Kids provides free bicycles to children and offers adults the chance to earn a bike by volunteering to repair bikes for children. The program encourages community involvement through hands-on repair opportunities.

hhsProviders.name: S.T.E.P. Ministries
hhsProviders.description: S.T.E.P. Ministries offers tutoring for at-risk children in public schools and a Christian mentoring program to provide additional support and guidance.

hhsProviders.name: Teen Dating Abuse Hotline
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Available to teens and young adults facing dating abuse.
hhsProviders.description: The Teen Dating Abuse Hotline provides a 24/7 confidential and safe space for teens and young adults experiencing dating abuse. Operated by Loveisrespect, the hotline connects callers with trained advocates who offer support, information, and resources.

hhsProviders.name: The First Tee
hhsProviders.organization: The First Tee of Central Arkansas
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to youth ages 5-18
hhsProviders.description: The First Tee program teaches life skills to youth through the game of golf, focusing on character building, respect, and perseverance. With a structured curriculum, the program provides a safe environment for developing essential life skills.

hhsProviders.name: Job Corps
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Youth ages 16 - 24 who meet income and citizenship/residency requirements
hhsProviders.description: Job Corps provides comprehensive job training and remedial education for young people ages 16-24, equipping them with marketable skills, work experience, and the necessary tools to achieve personal independence and long-term employment.

hhsProviders.name: Immerse Arkansas
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Youth ages 14 - 21 seeking safe housing and development support
hhsProviders.description: Immerse Arkansas provides shelter and specialized youth development programs for ages 14-21, focusing on high expectations, nurturing relationships, and a supportive environment to foster resilience, healing, and personal growth.

hhsProviders.name: HOUSEABOUTIT, Community Economic Development Agency, Benefit Enrollment Center (BEC) of Pulaski County
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Needy families with children
hhsProviders.description: HOUSEABOUTIT provides TANF and other assistance to needy families with children, supporting community development and self-sufficiency.

hhsProviders.name: HIPPY Home Instruction for Parents of Preschool Youngsters
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Parents of children ages 3-5
hhsProviders.description: HIPPY is a 30-week school readiness and parent involvement program for parents of young children. Most programs run concurrently with the school year and are staffed by professional coordinators and home-based educators.

hhsProviders.name: Child Support Enforcement Office
hhsProviders.organization: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to custodial parents and legal guardians with child support orders
hhsProviders.description: The Child Support Enforcement Office ensures compliance with child support court orders, offering services to custodial parents to receive due support for child welfare and family stability.

hhsProviders.name: Cru Inner City
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals and families in need of basic resources or youth development support.
hhsProviders.description: Cru Inner City provides compassionate resources such as Homeless Care Kits, Boxes of Love, and school supplies to local churches and ministry partners. They also offer training and curriculum for youth and adult development.

hhsProviders.name: Centers for Youth and Families, Family Counseling Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Youth up to age 26 and their families
hhsProviders.description: The Family Counseling Center offers a range of support services including outpatient counseling, school-based therapy, case management, and day treatment. It also provides emergency shelter, therapeutic foster care, and residential services. The Parent Center offers parenting classes, support groups, and additional resources for families.

hhsProviders.name: Centers for Youth and Families Residential Services
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Children and teens with severe behavioral or emotional issues
hhsProviders.description: Centers for Youth and Families Residential Services provides 24-hour care and support for children and teens with severe behavioral and emotional challenges. The program includes comprehensive behavioral treatment, psychiatric services, education, and medical care, involving families in the healing process.

hhsProviders.name: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Central Arkansas
hhsProviders.organization: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Central Arkansas
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Children and youth ages 6-18 in Central Arkansas
hhsProviders.description: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Central Arkansas provides one-to-one mentoring to foster positive role models in children's lives, aiming to help all youth reach their full potential.

hhsProviders.name: Catholic Adoption Services
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Birth mothers considering adoption.
hhsProviders.description: Catholic Adoption Services is a licensed non-profit agency providing support to birth mothers considering adoption, including counseling, legal assistance, and medical care. Adoption plans can be tailored with varying levels of openness.

hhsProviders.name: ARKids First
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Arkansas children under 19, meeting income and other eligibility requirements.
hhsProviders.description: ARKids First provides health insurance coverage for Arkansas children through two coverage options, ensuring access to healthcare for children who might otherwise go without.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas National Guard Youth Challenge Program
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Ages 16-18, drug-free, no felony convictions
hhsProviders.description: The Arkansas National Guard Youth Challenge Program is a preventive at-risk youth program offering GED/High School Diploma attainment, job skills training, leadership development, and a mentoring relationship in a 22-week residential phase followed by year-long mentoring.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Home Visiting Network
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Expectant parents and parents with infants and young children.
hhsProviders.description: The Arkansas Home Visiting Network provides culturally relevant, family-focused home visits addressing maternal and child health, parenting, child development, and school readiness. Services are delivered by trained professionals to support families until children enter kindergarten.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Advocates for Children and Families
hhsProviders.organization: Arkansas Advocates for Children and Families
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to all Arkansas residents seeking resources and support for child and family advocacy.
hhsProviders.description: For over 35 years, Arkansas Advocates for Children and Families (AACF) has led efforts in research and policy advocacy to improve the lives of Arkansas's children, impacting state-level reforms that prioritize children's well-being.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Arts Center

address.street: 2510 Cantrell Road, Riverdale Mall Shopping Center

hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to youth and families interested in art and theater programs.
hhsProviders.description: The Arkansas Arts Center offers youth art and theater programs, as well as Spring Break and summer programs, engaging children in creative education and cultural enrichment.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Coalition Against Domestic Violence
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals affected by domestic violence or in need of support for relationship abuse issues.
hhsProviders.description: The Arkansas Coalition Against Domestic Violence works to eliminate domestic violence and promote healthy families. Services include bilingual support (Spanish) and hotlines for domestic violence and teen dating abuse.

hhsProviders.name: Americans for Prosperity, Central Arkansas
hhsProviders.description: Americans for Prosperity in Central Arkansas focuses on reforming the justice system to promote public safety, reduce future criminal behavior, and support successful reentry into society.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Public Policy Panel
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to Arkansas communities seeking advocacy support.
hhsProviders.description: The Arkansas Public Policy Panel promotes social and economic justice through advocacy, civic participation, and community organization support, emphasizing an inclusive and transparent political process.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Time After Time (A.T.A.T.)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals reintegrating into society post-sentence; community members seeking education on safety.
hhsProviders.description: Arkansas Time After Time (A.T.A.T.) aims to differentiate between repeat violent sexual predators and those working to reintegrate into society after serving their sentence, promoting community safety and reintegration.

hhsProviders.name: Central Arkansas Reentry Coalition (C.A.R.E.)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals reintegrating from incarceration or homelessness
hhsProviders.description: The Central Arkansas Reentry Coalition (C.A.R.E.) provides comprehensive reentry support, offering community reintegration resources and assistance for individuals transitioning from incarceration and other challenging life events. C.A.R.E. collaborates with social justice advocates, governmental agencies, and other community organizations to support successful reintegration.

hhsProviders.name: Citizens First Congress
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to individuals and organizations interested in community and policy advocacy
hhsProviders.description: Citizens First Congress (CFC) harnesses the power of grassroots organizations to expand opportunities and improve quality of life in Arkansas, advocating for transparent, accountable, and inclusive government.

hhsProviders.name: DecARcerate
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to all Arkansas residents interested in criminal justice reform.
hhsProviders.description: DecARcerate is dedicated to ending mass incarceration in Arkansas through education, legislation, and advocacy, working toward a state where individuals who cause harm are rehabilitated and reintegrated into supportive communities.

hhsProviders.name: Families Against Mandatory Minimums (FAMM)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to individuals and families impacted by mandatory minimum sentencing and interested in justice reform.
hhsProviders.description: Families Against Mandatory Minimums (FAMM) is dedicated to fair and effective justice reform, advocating for policies that promote community safety, individual accountability, and dignity within the American justice system.

hhsProviders.name: Arkansas Total Care
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Medicaid beneficiaries with complex behavioral health or developmental disabilities
hhsProviders.description: Coordinates care for Medicaid beneficiaries with complex needs in Arkansas.

hhsProviders.name: CareSource PASSE
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Medicaid beneficiaries with complex behavioral health or developmental disabilities
hhsProviders.description: Provides coordinated health services for PASSE members in Arkansas.

hhsProviders.name: Empower Healthcare Solutions
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Medicaid beneficiaries with complex behavioral health or developmental disabilities
hhsProviders.description: Empower Healthcare Solutions coordinates comprehensive care for PASSE participants in Arkansas.

hhsProviders.name: Second Chance Youth Ranch
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Youth facing behavioral or legal challenges
hhsProviders.description: A Christian-based residential program that provides a supportive, family-like environment for youth facing behavioral or legal difficulties. Offers mentorship, education, counseling, and spiritual support to help youth make positive, principled choices.

hhsProviders.name: Teen Challenge of Arkansas
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Young men and women facing addiction, behavioral challenges, or legal issues
hhsProviders.description: A faith-based residential program dedicated to recovery, rehabilitation, and spiritual growth for youth experiencing addiction, behavioral challenges, or legal troubles. Offers long-term residential care, counseling, Biblical discipleship, life skills, and vocational training to help participants reenter society.

hhsProviders.name: The CALL
services: Mentorship for Youth in Foster Care
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Children and youth in need of foster care placement; families willing to provide foster care
hhsProviders.description: A statewide organization in Arkansas dedicated to providing safe, nurturing environments for children and youth facing detention or unstable circumstances. CALL focuses on recruiting, training, and supporting faith-based foster families, as well as offering mentorship and guidance to foster youth through community and faith-based engagement.

hhsProviders.name: Pathway to Freedom
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Adults currently incarcerated; program may be adapted for juvenile offenders
hhsProviders.hours: Varies by facility and program schedule
hhsProviders.description: Pathway to Freedom provides an evidence-based, spiritual reentry program designed for incarcerated adults, focusing on life skills, mentorship, and community reintegration. Its faith-based curriculum promotes personal and spiritual growth, while community connections and post-release support assist participants in securing employment and housing upon release.

hhsProviders.name: City Connections Inc. - TASC Program
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals in the justice system, individuals with substance abuse issues seeking a faith-based rehabilitation program
hhsProviders.description: The TASC (Treatment and Support Center) program, part of City Connections Inc., offers a faith-based alternative to imprisonment by providing drug and alcohol rehabilitation, mentorship for youth in the justice system, and community resources. The program includes substance abuse counseling, spiritual and prayer-based support, life skills training, and vocational opportunities to aid reentry.

hhsProviders.name: Life Skills for Youth (LSY)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: At-risk youth in the Little Rock area seeking after-school or summer programs
hhsProviders.hours: Varies; check website or contact for program schedule
hhsProviders.description: Life Skills for Youth offers after-school and summer programs aimed at supporting at-risk youth in a safe, faith-based environment. Their programs focus on developing positive behaviors, social skills, career readiness, leadership, and teamwork.

hhsProviders.name: Victory Outreach Recovery Home
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Adolescents struggling with addiction or behavioral challenges
hhsProviders.description: Victory Outreach Recovery Home provides a faith-based, residential program focused on recovery, personal growth, and transformation through Christian counseling, life skills education, and mentorship. Their holistic approach is aimed at supporting adolescents in achieving long-term success and reintegration.

hhsProviders.name: Rainbow of Challenges
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Individuals with developmental disabilities and children who qualify for the Arkansas Better Chance program.
hhsProviders.description: Rainbow of Challenges provides comprehensive services and programs for individuals with developmental disabilities and their families, offering residential support, education, workforce assistance, and community activities.

hhsProviders.name: Conway Counseling & Wellness Center - Home Office
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to individuals, families, and communities seeking mental health and wellness services.
hhsProviders.hours: Monday-Thursday 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM Friday 8:30 AM - 3:00 PM
hhsProviders.description: A full-service counseling and wellness center providing holistic care throughout Central Arkansas.

hhsProviders.name: Conway Counseling & Wellness Center - Family Center
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to individuals, families, and communities seeking mental health and wellness services.
hhsProviders.description: A full-service counseling and wellness center providing holistic care throughout Central Arkansas.

hhsProviders.name: Conway Counseling & Wellness Center - Hot Springs Office
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to individuals, families, and communities seeking mental health and wellness services.
hhsProviders.hours: Monday-Thursday 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM Friday 8:30 AM - 3:00 PM
hhsProviders.description: A full-service counseling and wellness center providing holistic care throughout Central Arkansas.

hhsProviders.name: Delta Counseling Associates - Crossett Office
hhsProviders.type: Mental Health and Substance Use Services
services: Drug and Alcohol Safety Education Program (DASEP)
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Open to individuals and families seeking mental health or substance use services.
hhsProviders.hours: Monday-Thursday 7:45 AM - 5:30 PM Friday 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM
hhsProviders.description: Provides comprehensive mental health and substance use services, including education, emergency support, and rehabilitation.

hhsProviders.name: Delta Counseling Associates - Dumas Office
hhsProviders.type: Mental Health and Substance Use Services
services: Drug and Alcohol Safety Education Program (DASEP)

hhsProviders.name: Glenhaven Youth Ranch
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Applicants must be aged 6-16, with preference for ages 11-14. Must not have a felony record, sexual offenses, severe behavioral disorders, addiction issues, or medical conditions limiting participation.

Applications involve multiple phases, including submission of psychological evaluations and academic records.

hhsProviders.name: Soaring Wings Ranch
hhsProviders.eligibilityCriteria: Children must have a legal guardian, be aged 6-17, have a full-scale IQ of at least 70, no history of violent behavior or serious criminal record, and the ability to attend public school. Willingness to attend church and commit for at least one year is required.
hhsProviders.description: Soaring Wings Ranch offers a nurturing, Christian-based environment for youth aged 6-17. The ranch focuses on life skills, education, and spiritual development to help children grow into responsible and capable individuals.
